docs.lead_paragraph: PROF. YOUMAN'S LECTURE IN BROOKLYN. On Monday evening last, Prof. YOUMANS gave the first of a series of three lectures on Chemistry, as applicable to organic life-the nature of Alcohol, and its effects upon the human system, at the lecture-room of Rev. Mr. BEECHER'S Church, Brooklyn. The lecture was well attended by many of the most intelligent citizens, who listened to the able lecturer with the most profound attention.

headline.main: John Quincy Adams and Rev. Dr. Cox.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: DEAR SIR--In your brief review of Dr. Cox's " Interviews Memorable and Useful," referring to the Doctor's interview with Hon. J. Q. ADAMS, you intimate your belief that Mr. ADAMS "entered into the discussion as a pleasant intellectual exercise," although "Dr. Coxtook the whole affair seriously."

docs.lead_paragraph: LEOPOLD VON BUCH died at Berlin on the 4th March, aged 76 years. He was the associate of HUMBOLDT. ENCKE and RITTER, to each of whom an active scientific career of more than half a century has been allotted. VON BUCH was born in 1777, and was a pupil of WERNER, the great founder of geological science, at the School of Mines in Freiberg, Saxony.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE CASE OF AITCHINSON.--This culprit, tried and convicted of the crime of murder, in the Queens County Court of Oyer and Terminer last week, was recommended to the mercy of the Court by the Jury, in consideration of his long incarceration and the state of his and the state of his health. The Judge, in passing sentence, stated that he could not unite in that recommendation.

docs.lead_paragraph: A SINGLE OBJECT. Nature has provided but one great luminary daily to enlighten the world. Numerous lights are feebler ones. In like manner, many objects destroy unity of action, but an individual one of magnitude consolidates it and gives it effect. We need attention to learn--concentration to act.
docs.snippet: A SINGLE OBJECT. Nature has provided but one great luminary daily to enlighten the world. Numerous lights are feebler ones. In like manner, many objects destroy unity of action, but an individual one of magnitude consolidates it and gives it effect....

docs.lead_paragraph: History, like Madame TUSSAUD'S wax-works, has its chamber of horrors. There we find RAVAILLAC, the regicide, BRINVILLIERS, the poisoner; and, no doubt, in the twentieth century, students will read of ARCULARIUS, the suffocator.

headline.main: THE SOUTH.; Letters on the Productions Industry, and Resources of the Southern States. Number Eight Why Free Labor is not more Profitable than Slane Labor, now, in Virginia. The Dificult Question of disposing of the Slaves. Their Condition. The condition of the Free Blacks at the South.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: In my last, it was made to appear that the cost of employing Slave labor in Virginia over free labor in New-York, was equal to an addition of one dollar to every dollar now expended for labor.
docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New-York Times: In my last, it was made to appear that the cost of employing Slave labor in Virginia over free labor in New-York, was equal to an addition of one dollar to every dollar now expended for labor.

byline.original: Special Correspondence of the N.Y.Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: WATER FOR BROOKLYN.--Late on Friday afternoon last, a special meeting of the Common Council was called for the same evening, to consider the Water question.
